Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Priority \Pri*or"i*ty\, n. [Cf. F. priorit['e]. See {Prior}, a.] 1. The quality or state of being prior or antecedent in time, or of preceding something else; as, priority of application. [1913 Webster]
2. Precedence; superior rank. --Shak. [1913 Webster]
{Priority of debts}, a superior claim to payment, or a claim to payment before others. [1913 Webster]
Syn: Antecedence; precedence; pre["e]minence. [1913 Webster]

priority n 1: status established in order of importance or urgency; "...its precedence as the world's leading manufacturer of pharmaceuticals"; "national independence takes priority over class struggle" [syn: {precedence}, {precedency}] 2: preceding in time [syn: {antecedence}, {antecedency}, {anteriority}, {precedence}, {precedency}] [ant: {posteriority}]
